task.title: Enabling Calendar Subscriptions
task.abstract: First-year Calendar Subscriptions begin the day the Direct Debit Agreement is submitted and extends to the end of the Calendar End Month and Day. When the subscription renews, the subscription End Date and the Direct Debit Agreement end date are extended through the next year.

step.cmd: Navigate to the eStore app and click the Subscription Plans tab. Click New.
Select Calendar in the Type picklist.
Check the Is Direct Debit Enabled checkbox.
Set Invoice Days Variable (days). The system automatically creates a Sales Order that mirrors the current active subscription "X" number of days prior to subscription expiration.
Select Calendar End Day. Note: Non-Direct Debit Enabled Subscription Plans require a Payment Gateway assignment when Auto-Renew enabled.

If the subscription is to auto-renew, or extend the direct debit agreement at the end of the term: Select “Required” from the Auto Renewed picklist. The system will update the amount of each payment and extend the term of the agreement to match the renewal period.
Check Require Payment Method Note: Non-Direct Debit Enabled Subscription Plans require a Payment Gateway assignment when Auto-Renew enabled.
Leave Bill Cycle: AUTO and Bill Cycle Day: (blank)
Select “Automatic Payment” from Schedule Type picklist

Select the desired frequency from Schedule Frequency picklist (e.g. Annually, Quarterly, Monthly)Note: The direct debit payment processor only supports: Annually, Quarterly, and Monthly. Monthly and Quarterly payment frequency should not be attributed to first-year, calendar subscriptions after the first calendar month.
